discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B --> Okta integration is only available with a subscription of the IAM Security module.
D --> For AWS, Prisma Cloud supports a 1:1 mapping between the Okta app and your AWS account. If you have onboarded more than one AWS account on Prisma Cloud, you must create additional instances of the Okta app and generate API keys for each AWS account for which you want to ingest single sign-on (SSO) data.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-iam-security/integrate-prisma-cloud-with-okta

choices.B: A valid subscription for the IAM security module
choices.D: Multiple instances of the Okta app
choices.C: An Okta API token for the primary AWS account

questions.question_text: What are two key requirements for integrating Okta with Prisma Cloud when multiple Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud accounts are being used? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) using Wild Cards

questions.question_text: Which resource and policy type are used to calculate AWS Net Effective Permissions? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
BD
"The list of AWS policy types and identities that are used to calculate the net effective permissions are as follows:
AWS IAM role
AWS IAM policy
AWS IAM group
AWS service control policies (SCPs)
Role trust relationships
Permission boundaries
NotAction
Policies with wild card support
If your cloud environment has additional resource types, Prisma Cloud does not factor them into the net-effective permissions.
In addition, permissions can also be set by a resource-based policy. The following AWS resource-based policies are supported in the net effective permissions calculation:
Lambda function
S3 bucket
SQS queue
SNS topic
ECS task definition
Secret manager
KMS key
Lambda layer version"

Selected Answer: BC
When onboarding a single GCP project to Prisma Cloud using a Terraform script, the two steps that can be performed are:

B. Create the Prisma Cloud role.
C. Enable the required APIs for Prisma Cloud.
Yes, B and C are correct options.

choices.C: enable the required APIs for Prisma Cloud.
choices.D: publish the flow log to a storage bucket.
choices.A: enable flow logs for Prisma Cloud.

A Prisma Cloud administrator is onboarding a single GCP project to Prisma Cloud.
Which two steps can be performed by the Terraform script? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C

Click Delete if you want to remove the notification from the alarm center. Once deleted, a similar alarm will not appear for the next 24 hours, if the same error occurs in that time period. After 24 hours, a similar error will generate a new alarm notification.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/manage-prisma-cloud-alarms/review-alarms

questions.question_text: When an alert notification from the alarm center is deleted, how many hours will a similar alarm be suppressed by default?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C

An admission controller is code that intercepts requests to the API server for creating objects. There are two types of admission controllers: built-in and dynamic. Prisma Cloud implements a dynamic admission controller.
Dynamic admission controllers are built as webhooks. After registering to intercept admission requests, they assess requests against policy, and then accept or reject those requests. In Kubernetes terms, these are known as validating admission webhooks.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/access_control/open_policy_agent

questions.question_text: Which component of a Kubernetes setup can approve, modify, or reject administrative requests?
